title: Propagate Tactical tab panel styling, interaction polish, and layout conventions to all tabs

requirements.summary: Restyle BASICS, MEDICAL, INFO, UTILITIES, WEAPONS, and SETTINGS primary sections to match Tactical tab panel look by reusing existing Tactical CSS patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: Each non-tactical tab renders its main content inside card/panel containers that visually match the Tactical tab panels (border weight, glow, texture, and overall density).
The updated non-tactical tabs no longer appear as mostly-unstyled content blocks; they present information as structured, Tactical-style panels/sections.
No user-facing text is changed away from English.

file_operations.description: Refactor/reuse Tactical tab panel styling by introducing shared HUD panel variants that mirror `.tactical-panel` (bordered inset-glow look, textured panel background, dense typography) and apply them via class composition for non-tactical tabs; keep `.tactical-panel` behavior unchanged.

Wrap BASICS tab primary sections (stats, hazards, vitals) into Tactical-style panel containers by applying existing Tactical panel class patterns (e.g., reuse `.tactical-panel` on `HudPanel` wrappers) without changing displayed text or data logic.
Update MEDICAL tab layout so its main readouts are placed inside one or more Tactical-style panel containers (reuse `.tactical-panel` look) without changing medical copy or calculations.
Apply Tactical-style panel classes to INFO tab primary panels (subsystems/log/console sections) so they match Tactical tab visual density and textured panel treatment.
Apply Tactical-style panel classes to UTILITIES tab primary panels (modules and ambience) and adjust internal section wrappers so content reads as structured Tactical-style sections.
Apply Tactical-style panel classes to WEAPONS tab primary panels (loadout/details/ammunition) so the overall panel framing matches Tactical tab panels.
Apply Tactical-style panel classes to SETTINGS tab primary sections so all settings groups render inside Tactical-like textured/glowing panels while preserving all existing labels and descriptions.

requirements.summary: Propagate Tactical tab hover/transition/emphasis interaction polish to comparable interactive elements across non-tactical tabs while preserving all behaviors and audio cues.
acceptanceCriteria: Interactive rows and controls in non-tactical tabs have visible hover/focus/active feedback comparable in intensity and style to Tactical tab elements (e.g., border-color shift, background tint, transition).

Any existing animations already present in the codebase for the Tactical tab (e.g., pulse/glow emphasis patterns) are reused consistently where they make sense in other tabs, without introducing distracting motion.
All existing click/toggle behaviors, audio cues, and store updates continue to work as before.

file_operations.description: Create shared interaction classes modeled after Tactical patterns (e.g., similar to `.tactical-contact-item` hover/transition and existing `pulse`/glow keyframes) and map them onto existing non-tactical element classNames (buttons/rows/toggles/select triggers) via CSS selectors; do not change functional JS behavior.
Add Tactical-style interactive row classes to module rows so hover/focus/active feedback matches Tactical intensity while keeping toggle handlers, audio cues, and store updates unchanged.
Apply Tactical-style interaction classes to weapon slot buttons and select controls (trigger/rows) to match Tactical hover/transition polish; preserve selection logic and sounds.

Apply Tactical-style interaction classes to setting rows and key controls (switch/select/slider area) so hover/focus states feel consistent with Tactical; preserve confirmation modal behavior and audio cues.

Ensure INFO subsystem interactive values (currently `.interactive`) receive Tactical-style hover/focus/emphasis styling via className adjustments (if needed) while keeping click/confirm flows and logging/audio unchanged.
Add Tactical-style hover/active polish to hazard rows where appropriate (read-only rows can still have subtle emphasis on hover) without changing hazard status text or logic.
Apply Tactical-style list-row hover/focus styling to log entries (where appropriate) while maintaining scroll behavior and rendering logic.
Apply Tactical-style emphasis/hover/focus styling to console history rows and console input/submit areas using className hooks, preserving command execution, auto-scroll, and audio cues.

requirements.summary: Standardize tab content padding, spacing, and overflow/scrolling to match Tactical tab container conventions across STANDARD and TACTICAL display modes.
acceptanceCriteria: All tabs have consistent outer padding and spacing rules comparable to `.tactical-tab` (scaled padding, consistent section gaps).
In both STANDARD and TACTICAL display modes, tab content remains usable (no clipped content; scrolling works where needed).
The TACTICAL tab visibility/behavior remains unchanged (still conditional on Tactical Mode being enabled).

file_operations.description: Introduce/adjust shared `.tab-content` layout rules so all tabs follow Tactical-like container conventions (padding scaled by `--hud-scale`, consistent internal gaps, and predictable overflow/scroll behavior); ensure `.tactical-tab` remains unchanged and remains the reference implementation.
Align BASICS tab grid wrappers with the standardized tab container spacing conventions (consistent gaps and scroll behavior) while preserving landscape/portrait layout logic.

Adjust INFO tab internal spacing to match Tactical conventions (consistent section gaps and container padding) and ensure scroll behavior remains predictable for log/console areas in both display modes.
Normalize UTILITIES tab layout spacing (panel gaps and internal padding) to match Tactical container conventions and ensure content scrolls instead of clipping when needed.
Normalize WEAPONS tab grid spacing and overflow so panels keep consistent gaps and the tab scrolls cleanly under both STANDARD and TACTICAL display modes.
Normalize SETTINGS tab spacing and scrolling (especially long settings lists) to align with Tactical container padding/gaps and ensure no clipped content.
